name: Aqua Hotel

reviews.title: Hoping this is a temporary blip
reviews.text: The Aqua hotel has been my preferred place to stay whenever I'm in Brussels for some time so I was disappointed with aspects of my most recent stay.

reviews.title: Aqua hotel Brussels on new year's eve 2012
reviews.text: The biggest problem was the absence of hot water in the morning which took so long to arrive that I called Reception, who told me all was well so I just needed to be patient. When it finally did come, I must have run the equivalent of a good bath-full of potable water down the drain which rather undermines the hotel's eco-credentials. I was staying on floor -2 for the first time so I wonder if the problem is specific to that floor as it has never been a problem on previous stays.

reviews.title: Not the best hotel in Brussels: many negatives
reviews.text: A rather more minor issue is that when, on the advice of Reception, I got in the lift to go to my room, the lift just dropped then stopped, without opening the doors. The person who responded to the alarm unfortunately didn't appear to understand my English so I resigned myself to a long wait, but perhaps he did, as suddenly the buttons were working again and I transferred at -1 to the other lift to continue my journey down.

reviews.title: Good, new hotel new Avenue Louise station
reviews.text: An even more minor issue was that there seemed to be a problem in the breakfast catering area the day I stayed as many tables were uncleared, necessitating the appearance of a large industrial trolley complete with very dirty-looking plastic bin, into which the table were cleared. Not a particularly pleasing sight at breakfast, and not one that has been evident before.

reviews.title: Good central location, comfortable rooms
reviews.text: Otherwise it was the hotel I know and love - great rooms, free WiFi, bright, close to the Metro. Just hope that December was a blip!

reviews.title: Modern and stylish but just a little bland; a good budget hotel
reviews.text: Recently built hotel, very stylishly decked out. Free wifi, comfortable bed, and most aspects very satisfactory. Friendly, helpful staff. Located quite close to the Port de Namur metro station, along a minor side-street, so quiet. Some restaurants and bars in the general neighbourhood. It's a short walk to both the European business area and the city centre.

reviews.title: A bit disappointing
reviews.text: The hotel was let down by the breakfast arrangements. This was available at a serve-yourself area in the lower lobby. This was well-lit but rather unattractive. The selection of food itself was very limited, and the quality of what was on offer was distinctly bottom-of-the-market.

reviews.title: Hotel (cold) Aqua! Three days, no hot water
reviews.text: This is one of the lowest-priced hotels in this part of Brussels, so despite the disappointing breakfast it remains a good deal.

reviews.title: Better than expected!
reviews.text: The rooms in this hotel were not too bad, quite modern and comfortable. The restaurant is a bit crowded and claustrophobic being in the basement. The service at breakfast was not great and the choice was not fantastic and that's where they let themselves down. Not a bad location. Colleagues had problems with hot water so beware. Receptionist who said he was the manager was surly and definitely not customer friendly.

reviews.title: Beware: no hot water!
reviews.text: There are two deal breakers for me when it comes to a hotel: cleanliness and hot water.

reviews.title: Good location, quite good value.
reviews.text: The hotel is in a side a very short walk from Metro Porte de Namur. The surrounding area has some interesting bars restaurants a short walk away. It's a modern hotel, and our room on the first floor was not very spacious, but it was clean, and had an excellent bathroom. Buffet breakfast, included in the price, was a bit disappointing, not much choice really. But the room was clean, the hotel quiet, and very good sleep quality. We would stay here again.

reviews.title: Business meeting with ETC colleagues
reviews.text: The Aqua hotel on Rue De Stassart was easy to find and close to my meeting venue. The design of the interior of hotel is interesting - super modern.

reviews.title: good for business
reviews.text: The hotel is situated only 10-15 minutes walking from the city center, which is ideal for an evening meal, and walking through an older neighborhood.

reviews.title: Convenience...... all you need for a decent price
reviews.text: The hotel is not really at a tipical tourist location,but close to some business areas. Grand Place is about a 30 min walk from here. It is on a small street which makes it calm and pleasant although close to one of the main streets of Brusseles. It is modern and clean. Price was much better than any similar level hotel in the area, so if you are on business at this part of Brussels I can recomand this hotel.

reviews.title: Good choise for bussines people
reviews.text: If you need to be for business close to Place Louise, this hotel is an excellent choice. The hotel is situated only 10-15 minutes walking from the city center, so even for pleasure trips it might fit. There are multiple public parking houses nearby and restaurant and bars just around the corner. It is a very new and modern hotel, where you have all facilities you need. The rooms are very spacious and the bed is comfortable. There is free wifi and the breakfast has plenty of choice and is of good quality. So all in all, a nice place to spend the night in Brussels.

reviews.title: Decent hotel for good value
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is smart. Close to subway and EU administration centre, as well as to shopping area, however it is located in a small doggy street. The rooms are nicely furnished and clean but very, very small. It says there is Wi-Fi in the room, but I could not use it because the network was chocked. There was Wi-Fi in the lobby but it was unavailable for one morning – I was told they are repairing something. The staff was kind and helpful. Breakfast is decent but nothing spectacular. However with the prices of hotels in Brussels I believe this one has a good value and I would return.

reviews.title: Very good close to port namur.
reviews.text: This hotel is located 5 min walk from port namur metro station. If you arrive by train to central station you can use metro to get to the hotel or you can pay 10€ by taxi. The hotel staff was very helpfull and nice. We stayed in a family room on 1st floor. These rooms are two independent rooms with a door between, in a very funcional way. Rooms have wired internet and some have wifi that it is avaiable in the lobby. Breakfast was very good and varied.

reviews.title: Good hotel, but horrible street
reviews.text: From the airport you can get to the hotel by bus No 12 to Luxembourg and then you can walk or go 2 stops by another bus. The hotel is situated near quite busy street, but the street itself where the hotel is, looks dirty and at night a bit dangerous. The receptionist was very nice, smiling and willing to help me with everything. My room was in the -1 floor with view in some courtyard, I had to go a while through the hall, which was very narrow (as well as the staircase). The room equipment was standard, very nice was the electric kettle and tea, coffee and chocolate. My room didn't have a bathtub, just a shower. The breakfast was very good, wide choice of different food, fresh hot croissants, the only thing that bothered me was that the waitress asks you if you want coffee ot tea, you have to choose and can't have both (maybe you can if you ask afterwards, but I didn't have so much time). You can catch the wifi only in the lobby (not in my room), but there were two computers in the lobby with the printer at a disposal (although the keyboard wasn't standard qwerty, the letters were set up in a different way, which was a bit confusing:)

reviews.title: Great, modern hotel for an excellent price
reviews.text: This hotel was a great find. Inside the classy brick exterior, everything inside was modern and bright, with clean lines and pops of color. The breakfast spread was one of the best we've seen in Europe, and we particularly appreciated the chocolate eggs generously sprinkled throughout the hotel to help guests celebrate the Easter holiday. The location was a little off the beaten tourist path (15-20 minute walk to the central train station), but not insurmountable, and very close to an excellent little neighborhood brasserie. At the low price we found online, this hotel was an incredible value.

reviews.title: A little bit hidden, but a very comfort hotel close to the shopping center of Brussels
reviews.text: Aqua Hotel is in a small street close to the Namur Place in Brussels, close to the numerous shops and restaurants of the Louise district, FNAC, Inno and so on. 3 minutes of the subway station. But the most important is the hotel and the room, of course!

description: In historical districtThis family-friendly hotel is located in Brussels (Ixelles - Avenue Louise), close to Egmont Palace, Mont des Arts, and Camille Lemonnier Museum. Also nearby are Royal Museums of Fine Arts of Belgium and Rene Magritte Museum.Fitness facilitiesIn addition to complimentary wireless Internet access, Aqua Hotel Brussels provides complimentary high-speed (wired) Internet access, multilingual staff, and a meeting/conference room.Balconies, courtyard viewsLCD televisions come with digital channels. Guestrooms also feature complimentary wireless Internet access, complimentary high-speed (wired) Internet access, and refrigerators.
